title: A Tour in Tartan-Land
author: Bede, Cuthbert
snippet: In the crisis of his fate, SirWilliam had cried to St. Katherine to aid him ; and, ingratitude for her fancied interference, he built the Chapelof St. Katherine, in the Hopes, on the Pentland hills. The hill from whence the monarch viewed the chase isstill called ' the King's Hill;' and the place where SirWilliam hunted is yet known by the name of 'theKnight's Field.'
